slidelink.displaytext: Elements of Effluent Systems at Plant 1
Elements of Effluent Systems at Plant 2
Effluent Systems at Plant 2-Current and Future

terms.term: Activated Sludge 1 - Provides secondary treatment for Plant 1 flows using the activated sludge process
Activated Sludge 2 - Provides secondary treatment for Plant 1 flows using the activated sludge process with full nitrification and denitrification capabilities
Clarifiers D, E, F, and G. These clarifiers are fed from the A-Side Primary Distribution Box. The effluent from these clarifiers is routed to the OAS for secondary treatment
Transition structure the two ocean outfall pipes pass through independently. The 78-inch outfall enters the box as a 120-inch line from Surge Tower 1 and exits the box as 78-inch pipe
Clarifiers H, I, J, K, & L. These clarifiers are fed from the B-Side Primary Distribution Box. The effluent from these clarifiers is routed to the TFSC for secondary treatment
Clarifiers M, N, O, P, & Q. These clarifiers are fed from the C-Side Primary Distribution Box. The effluent from these clarifiers is routed to the TFSC for secondary treatment
Conveys combined effluent flows to OOBS or towards EPSA, depending on which outfall discharge pump station is in operation
Effluent Junction Box - Located just outside Plant 1, conveys combined effluents from Plant 1 and OCWD to Plant 2 for ocean outfall discharge
Effluent Pump Station Annex - One of the two current pump stations along with OOBS for ocean outfall discharge

Green Acres Project - Refers to tertiary treated water produced by OCWD from the secondary treated wastewater effluent from Plant 1. This recycled water is primarily used by various customers for irrigation and industrial use.
Interactive calculator that estimates the flow from the 120” outfall line using the 60”/78” bypass gravity line
Ground Water Replenishment System - The world's largest water purification system for indirect potable reuse; a joint project of OC San and OCWD
Located at Plant 1, it provides screening and flow monitoring of the Plant 1 secondary effluent flows to GWRS
Irvine Ranch Water District
Junction Box 8 - Serves as a transition structure for conveying OAS flows to either OOBS or EPSA and also to convey flows from effluent junction structure via JB-A
Junction Box A - Can either receive flows from JB-8 for conveyance to OOBS via the Effluent Junction Structure or conveys flow from the effluent junction structure to EPSA via JB-8
Junction Box C - Is an intermediary junction box between JB-1 and JB-A

Low Flow Pump Station - New pump station for ocean outfall discharge primarily designed for handling low flows - up to 120 MGD. This pump station is currently being constructed as part of CIP Project J-117B
Million Gallons per Day
National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System - Federal permit program regulating pollutant discharges into waters of the United States
Oxygen Activated Sludge - A secondary treatment process at Plant 2
Orange County Water District - Agency responsible for water supply to more than 2 5 million residents in north and central Orange County
Ocean Outfall Booster Station - One of the two pump stations along with EPSA for ocean outfall discharge
Primary Effluent Distribution Box 2 - Receives RO centrate from GWRS, although it is primarily intended to capture and convey any emergency primary effluent discharges for ocean outfall disposal
Primary Effluent Junction Box 1 connects the Plant 1 - 84-inch and 66-inch secondary effluent lines
Primary Effluent Wet Well - Separable part of the EPSA wetwell which could receive flows for discharging through the 120-inch outfall
Ocean Outfall System Rehabilitation – Constructs a new LOFLO Pump Station to handle reduced outfall flow due to the diversion of reclaimable Plant 2 secondary treated effluent to GWRS
OCWD Project – GWRS Final Expansion – Constructs systems to convey Plant 2 reclaimable water flows to GWRS
Headworks Modifications – Modifies Plant No 2 Headworks to separate reclaimable and non-reclaimable flows

Reverse osmosis (RO) centrate is the wastestream from GWRS's RO process. RO is the second of the three-step GWRS water purification processes (water microfiltration, reverse osmosis, and ultraviolet light with hydrogen peroxide)
Rotations per Minute - It is the maximum rated pump impeller rotation speed.
Secondary Effluent Junction Box - Receives any east side AS1 effluent for ocean outfall discharge via the EJB
Secondary Effluent Junction Box - Receives secondary treated flows from the OAS and directs it to JB 8

Secondary Effluent Junction Box 3 - Located at Plant 1; receives the GWRS discharge and secondary effluent overflows from GWRS screening for conveyance to the ocean outfall discharge via SEJB-7 and EJB
Receives the AS1 secondary flows for routing to either the OCWD GWRS screening facility or the OCWD GAP water supply pumps
Secondary Effluent Junction Box 6 - Conveys the AS2 effluent flows to GWRS screening facility. It is also connected to SEJB-7 for conveying any residual effluent to EJB for ocean outfall discharge
Secondary effluent Junction Box 7 - Receives effluent streams from GWRS and any residual effluent from AS2 and conveys them to the EJB for ocean outfall discharge
Secondary Effluent Wet Well - Separable part of the EPSA wetwell which could receive secondary treated flow from SEJB for disposal through the 78-inch outfall
Large diameter cylinder constructed on top of each of the two outfall pipes to provide air relief to the water being discharged through the ocean outfall pipes
Total Dynamic Head - Rated capacity of the pump in terms of total equivalent height (in feet) of water. It is the sum of static (difference in initial and final water elevations) and friction heads.
Trickling Filters - A secondary treatment process at Plant 1. (Plant 2 has TFSC.)
Trickling Filter Effluent Junction Box 2 - Located on the 66-inch secondary effluent line; receives the residual TF effluent for conveyance to Plant 2 for ocean outfall discharge via the EJB
Trickling Filter Pumping Station - Pumps primary effluent from the B & C side primary clarifiers to the TFSC for secondary treatment
Trickling Filter Solids Contactor - A secondary treatment process at Plant 2
